newsitem.title: ISRAEL: B.V.R. Technologies Q1 loss vs profit.
newsitem.headline: B.V.R. Technologies Q1 loss vs profit.

text.p: (in thousands of dollars except per share)
The 1996 first quarter net profit includes capital gains but company officials could not immediately confirm the size of the gain.
Backlogged orders total $69.6 million against $55.1 million on March 31, the Israeli company said in a statement.

The results, excluding subsidiaries, showed continued growth in sales and profits. Sales for the first three months rose to $7.052 million from $4.237 million a year earlier while operating profit was $60,000 against an operating loss of $543,000 a year earlier.
B.V.R. held 31 percent of Nexus Telecommunications Ltd as of March 31, 1997. Its share in the losses of Nexus in the first quarter amounted to $373,000 compared with $342,000 a year earlier.
B.V.R.'s share in the losses of its wholly owned subsidiary Entertainment Application of Virtual Reality Ltd in the first quarter was $854,000 against $448,000 a year earlier.
B.V.R. officials reached later said the company had a capital gain of $1.761 million in the first quarter of 1996.
